benchmarks.frequencyRegistrations.descri:
In what days during a given week you expect to register food waste. Usually, you would select the days that you produce foodstuff.

In the reports, you will see to which degree you are registering food waste on the days you have selected. This insight reveals if you are registering all the food waste that is produced. Remember that high data quality (Registering all your food waste) is crucial to get useful information out of the reports.

help.benchmark.timelineChart: Displaying the food waste according to the search preferences. The columns show individual accounts, while the curve shows the average of the selected accounts. Click a column to get specific data in the pie chart.
help.project.actions: Specify the actions you are going to implement in the business to try and bring down the food waste.
help.project.duration:
Duration by date: The project will run in a fixed date range regardless of registrations made.

Duration by registration days: The project will run for the number of days necessary for collecting the number of days set.
help.project.goals: Set percentage goals for your food waste project.
help.report.filterController.accounts: Select the accounts that you want data displayed from
help.report.filterController.datepicker: Specify the timeframe for which you want the report to display data.
help.report.filterController.domainFilte: Here you can filter the data found in the specified timeframe, based on their areas, products, and categories.
help.report.productCategoryChart: Displaying how the food waste is divided into product categories according to the search preferences  - either by cost or by amount. Click an area in the pie chart to zoom into the specific data.
help.report.productChart: Displays how the food waste is divided into products according to the search preferences  - either by cost or by amount. Click on an area in the pie chart to zoom into the specific data.
help.report.sales.actualCostPerPortion: Actual cost per portion (kr.) - By dividing the total production cost with the number of guests, we see the actual cost per portion.
help.report.sales.expectedRateOfReturn: Expected rate of return (%) - By multiplying the sales price with the number of produced portions, subtracting the total production cost and dividing this with the total production cost, we see the expected rate of return percentage.
help.report.sales.foodWasteAmount: Food waste amount (%) - By dividing the volume of food waste with the total production volume, we see how many percentage the volume of food waste represent in the total volume of the produced food.
help.report.sales.foodWasteCost: Food waste cost (%) - By dividing the cost of food waste with the total production cost, we see how many percentage the cost of food waste represent in the total cost of the produced food.
help.report.sales.foodWastePerGuestKg: Food waste per guest (kg.) - By dividing the volume of food waste with the number of guests, we see the volume of food waste per guest.
help.report.sales.foodWastePerGuestKr: Food waste per guest (kr.) - By dividing the cost of food waste with the number of guests, we see the value of food waste per guest.
help.report.sales.productionCostPerPorti: Production cost per portion (kr.) - By dividing the total production cost with the number of produced portions, we see the production cost per portion.
help.report.sales.productionEfficiency: Production efficiency (%) - By dividing the number of guests with the number of produced portions, we see how accurate is the planning of portions according to number of guests (calculated as one guest eats one portion).
help.report.sales.productionWeightPerPor: Production weight per portion (kg.) - By dividing the total production volume with the number of produced portions, we see the production volume per portion.
help.report.sales.rateOfReturn: Rate of return (%) - By subtrating the total production cost from the total income and dividing this with the total income, we see the rate of return percentage.
help.report.timelineChart: Displaying the food waste according to the search preferences in cost (curve) and amount (columns). Click a column to zoom into the specific data.
help.sales.enabledGuestRegistrations: Go to the registration page to register the number of guests.
help.sales.guests: Enter the number of guest of the day.
help.sales.income: Enter the total income of the day.
help.sales.producedPortions: Enter the number of produced portions of the day.
help.sales.productionCost: Enter the total value of the ingredients used for the food production of the day.
help.sales.salesPrice: Enter the sales price per portion.
help.sales.totalAmount: Enter the total amount of the ingredients used for the food production of the day.
help.settings.accountNameFormat: Decide whether accounts should be shown with their nicknames or company names.
help.settings.allowRegistrationsOnAnyPoi:
For a hierarchy like 'Buffet -> Salad', you will be able to register food waste both on 'Buffet' and on 'Salad' with this option enabled. 

If this option is disabled, you will only be able to register food waste on the last registration point in the hierarchy, which in the 'Buffet -> Salad' case is 'salad'
help.settings.canUseBluetooth:
Choose if you would like to allow communication with the Bluetooth scale. 

Please note that a restart of the tablet app is required, after updating this setting.
help.settings.content.areas: Areas with an open eye will be visible on the registration page. You can remove an area from the registration page by clicking the eye.
help.settings.content.categories: If you don't want to choose a category to get the products on the registration page, you can make the categories invisible by clicking the eye. When categories are visible, only categories which contain visible products will be presented on the registration page.
help.settings.content.products: Only visible products are possible to register on the registration page. Create your own products and price them.
help.settings.content.registrationPoints: This registration point is deactivated and will not be displayed on the Registration page.
help.settings.enableRegistrationComments: Allows to write a comment during food waste registration
help.settings.hasEsmileyScale: If you have an eSmiley scale, you can use it to register food waste
help.settings.notSubscribed: Displaying accounts you are not subscribed to. You can subscribe to any of the displayed accounts by clicking on them. Save the changes by clicking the 'Save' button.
help.settings.parent:
You can move this registration point and everything under it, by choosing a different parent for it. 

Please note that the type (Area, Category or Product) decides where it can be moved. 

Selecting "Top Level" will move it to the very first level in the hierarchy.
help.settings.primary.currency: Select the currency you want to use in your FoodWaste module.
help.settings.primary.database: The database will suggest categorised and priced products and ingredients when creating products and ingredients.
help.settings.primary.productUnit: Choose which unit you want to register your food waste.
help.settings.primary.show.deactivated.a: Choose if the deactivated areas will show on the registration page or not.
help.settings.sound: Select the sound you want to hear when you have completed a registration.
help.settings.subscribed: Displaying accounts you are subscribed to. You can unsubscribe any of the accounts by clicking on them. Save the changes by clicking the 'Save' button.

settings.enableGuestRegistrationFlowDesc: Adds option on food waste registration page to register guests amounts. You will not be able to register guest amounts via sales registration window afterwards.

settings.personalFoodwasteTargets.descri:
Here you set your expected food waste Total (overall) and per guest. In the reports, these goals are used as a tool to see how you are performing food waste wise compared to your goals.

Background information on how the system handles expected food waste: One month is always set to 30 days. One year is set to 360 days. When setting a weekly food waste goal the system will convert that goal into a monthly and yearly expectation. And these numbers are then used in the reports.
settings.processingGuestRegistrations: Processing guest registrations, this might take a moment...
settings.registrationPoints.allowRegistr: Allow food waste registrations on all registration points in the hierarchy
settings.registrationPoints.howTo.hierar:
For hierarchy like 'Buffet > Salad', you will be able to register food waste on both Buffet and Salad with this option enabled.

Click on {addIcon} below to add a new registration point into the hierarchy. Fill in name and other details so that people are able to register on that point.
settings.registrationPoints.howTo.title: How to setup your registration point hierarchy, value/kg and CO2 values
The value field allows you to keep track on your food waste costs. We use this value in our reports engine and registration history to show you the estimated costs. The value you input here needs to be cost for a kilo of waste of selected registration point.
tutorial.howToDefineTarget.title: Set targets
tutorial.howToRegister.content:
In order to show the correct results we need at least 5 times input (or something).

To register food waste, you simply click on {scaleIcon} Measure waste in the sidebar menu.
